definitions.example: He was granted permission to attend the meeting.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To bestow or confer, with or without compensation, particularly in answer to prayer or request; to give.
To agree with (someone) on (something); to accept (something) for the sake of argument; to admit to (someone) that (something) is true.
Used to mark the premise of a syllogistic argument
definitions.example: Granted that he has done nothing wrong, he should be set free.

definitions.definition: Used to concede a point, often before stating some contrasting information.
definitions.example: "You haven't been a very good father." "Granted."
